intro: Mammillaria geminispina var. tetracantha, commonly known as the four-spined mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, spherical shape and is covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking contrast to its green body. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
